Title: Experimental characterisation of two fully-developed enclosure fire regimes
Abstract: © 2015 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.This work revisits the principle characteristics of two unique regimes of behaviour of fully-developed compartment fires first identified during the immense body of research that came to define the compartment fire framework. Experimentation and computational modelling are used to explore, compare and contrast the characteristics of these two Regimes and identify the transition or break point between the two. Their relevance to the design of contemporary infrastructure and need for a greater understanding of both Regimes in this context is discussed.
